selection_reasoning: We are selecting the top-performing trials across all generations to focus on high-precision 'micro-rattling'. The analysis suggests that the current plateau is due to the decoupling of centers and radii in recent attempts; Gen 8 will revert to fully coupled (x,y,r) optimization with extremely tight solver tolerances and a focus on 'sliding' moves.

trial_selections.reasoning: Current all-time best (2.63598308). It represents the most successful 'basin' found so far and will serve as the primary seed for micro-rattling.
Second best approach (2.635977). Its penalty-based annealing provides a different gradient path and a slightly different configuration to the same high-performing region.
Third best unique approach (2.634). It used a different flavor of refinement that might be useful for escaping the 2.635983 plateau.
Best of the recent generation. Although it failed to beat the all-time best, its vectorized Jacobian implementation is the most efficient for multi-start searches.
